title: Bug 13725: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
description: Bug 13725: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
OB: When performing the steps to reproduce and selecting "Revert" from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: It is expected that reverting the file contents should not take more time than closing and reopening the file.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1) Open an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder "Eclipse SWT Custom Widgets" in the project "org.eclipse.swt" in the open source repository.
2) Select the end of the first line and enter a space character to mark the file as dirty.
3) Click on the close box in the editor tab.
4) Answer "no" to the "Do you want to save changes?" dialog.
5) Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
6) Alternatively, repeat steps 1) and 2), and then select "Revert" from the pop-up menu in the editor.
